description.narrative: The aim of the project is to undertake socioeconomic acclivities aimed creation of livelihood opportunity and building social cohesion

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
1. # (female and male) of unemployed youth, refugees, IDPs, returnees, women and other at-risk groups successfully trained and engaged in self or wage employments.
2. % of (female and male) unemployed youth, refugees, IDPs, returnees, and other at-risk groups and community members who receive trainings from this programme have livelihood opportunities and access to micro-financing, value chain and business development services.
3. # of women and men engaged in short term jobs
4. # of infrastructure projects (equipment, roads, markets, etc.) successfully implemented in the target communities
5. # of consultations and training events organized for community groups on participatory needs assessment and project implementation
6. # of community-based mechanisms for resolution of local conflicts
7. # of awareness sessions or trainings on environmental issues, gender, small arms among community members, displacement
8. # of people (F & M) receiving functional literacy training
9. Operations, PI, and M&E are capacitated to effectively deliver the expected outputs and outcome.

comment.narrative:
1. No unemployed youth, refugees, IDPs, returnees, women and other at-risk groups successfully trained and engaged in self or wage employments. 2. No unemployed youth, refugees, IDPs, returnees, and other at-risk groups and community members who receive trainings from this programme have livelihood opportunities and have access to micro-financing, value chain and business development services. 3. No women and men engaged in short term jobs.
4. No infrastructure projects (equipment, roads, markets, etc.) implemented in the target communities 5. No consultations and training events organized for community groups on participatory needs assessment and project implementation
6. No community-based mechanisms for resolution of local conflicts established 7. No awareness sessions or trainings on environmental issues, gender, small arms among community members, displacement conducted 8. No one (F & M) received functional literacy training
9. Operations, PI, and M&E were not adequately capacitated to effectively deliver the expected outputs and outcome.

1.1 440 (220 M & 220 F) 1.2. 10% 1.3. 60 (30 M & 30 F)
2.1. 2 2.2. 2
3.1 - 2 3.2-. 2 3.3 - 40 (36 F & 4 M)
4.1. 1 PI, 1 M&E, 1 Admin, 1 Finance, 1 Procurement staff will be employed and extend their support to effective implementation of the projects.

1.1-100% achieved 1.2 -100% achieved 2.1. -100% achieved 2.2- 100% achieved 3.1- 100% achieved 3.2-100% achieved 3.3 100% achieved 3.4 -100 % achieved
4.1 -100% achieved
The duration of the project initiation plan (PIP) was for one year till December 2020. Hence no targets and results for 2021.
The duration of the project initiation plan (PIP) was for one year till December 2020. Hence no targets and results for 2021.
